author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.en: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
segments.en: One person has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa.
segments.en: One person has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na ceva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
segments.en: One person has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
segments.en: One person has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.”
